main event: A pilot flying a Cessna spotted a metallic-looking object moving too fast to be an airliner on May 12, 1949.
interesting points: The object was observed glinting in the sunlight and appeared round in shape., The pilot initially thought it was an airliner but realized it was moving too fast and was larger than a jet., The object was observed for approximately 1 minute and 20 seconds., The pilot noted it was on a westerly course before it vanished into the sunlight., The incident was later discussed with a flight instructor, who advised the pilot to forget about it due to media coverage labeling it as a hoax.
witness description: a pilot with experience in photography and flying
